item.title: A romantic trip to Jeju along the <goddess of marriage> - Jeju, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
The Aewolhandam Walkway filmed the drama 'The Goddess of Marriage'

A romantic trip to Jeju along the <goddess of marriage>

Jeju, Jeju, Korea

On a path I left alone, if I met a love that is meant to be with my life ... . It will be the best moment in life that anyone dreams about once. In the drama <The Goddess of Marriage>, which shows different values and philosophies about love and marriage, a couple who met a fateful love on a trip to Jeju, which happened to happen by accident, appears. They will have to watch more about how the love that blossomed will develop in the future, but the journey of those who have traveled all over Jeju has thrilled the hearts of many. Along the way Wisdom (Nam Sang-mi) and Hyun-woo (Lee Sang-woo) walked together, how about dreaming a romantic trip that might happen to me?

scene # 1. Wisdom and Hyunwoo's First Meeting and Aewolhan Dam Trail

Wisdom, who is confused by the uncertain marriage, is on the plane for Jeju alone on the excuse of a business trip. Hyun-woo, who sleeps, leans toward Hyun-woo, who sits in the next seat, and Hyun-woo, who gives wisdom to her shoulders, sees the book she dropped in curiosity. The wisdom that disappeared in an instant as soon as the plane arrived in Jeju. But thanks to a book she forgot, the two of them accidentally reunite the next day, and after a misunderstanding, they start walking along the road.

On the third morning, Hyunwoo leads the wisdom of going alone. Wisdom is stylish, but he smiles brightly and runs along the coastal promenade. Uh, but where the hell are you ?! Even though she was immersed in the drama, the momentary spirit flashes in the fantastic scenery behind her.
Aewol Handam Trail. Even though it passed by briefly for only 2 ~ 3 seconds on the screen, it is too much to be considered as such a place. A walkway was created along the coastline of Handam Village located in Aewol-eup, Jeju, and the mood of walking along the path is amazing. Anyone who knows that this wonderful coastal walkway is hidden beneath the roadside is a place that can be counted as the hidden unexplored Jeju of Jeju Island. Nowadays, there are more and more tourists coming to this place through word of mouth and internet.

Walkway leading to Gwakjiwamul Beach

From the Aewol Handam Park, which is directly adjacent to the three-way intersection of Seoilju-do and Aewol entrance, go down the stairs to the coast and it is directly connected to the promenade. There is a good walking path from Handam Village to Gwakjiwamul Beach about 1.2km. Looking down from the hill, it has a flexible curve, and it takes about 20 minutes by walking from end to end. Inwardly bent, basalt and white sand, rounded like a mongdol, remind us of the secret beach. The mysterious lava stone statues carved by nature from a long time ago provide a highlight.

A white beach hidden in the middle of the promenade

Most of all, the scenery created by the blue sky and the white clouds and the sea glistening with emerald colors, as if popping popcorn, evokes excitement. Just looking at me feels calm and peaceful. As I jump into the landscape and see those who enjoy the sea to their heart's content, I think this is a fresh play. You can always move your mind even during the walk, so it's better to go ready to jump into the sea. Maybe it wasn't in the play, but Wisdom and Hyunwoo might have enjoyed snorkeling or bathing here.

Walking path looking at the emerald sea
scene # 2. The road of wisdom and Hyunwoo, from Dosoon Tea Garden to the Dragon Eye

Is there anything more enjoyable than traveling with a good-hearted person? Jiwoon and Hyunwoo spend a fun time with a hum, but it's not been days since they met. While walking between the tea fields while eating ice cream, the place where the children arrived after running through the truck like an innocent child. This situation is set in the play, and it takes more than an hour and a half by car from the Dosun Tea Garden to the Yongun-eori. It's a story that you can never walk or run on. Probably both places are full of charm, so I would have set it up like that.

Dosoon Tea Garden with an impressive green tea garden

Unlike the Osulloc Seogwang Tea Garden, which is popular among tourists, the Dosun Tea Garden spreads out in the southern part of Hallasan Mountain. Even walking slowly through the green tea field feels like a healing.
Located in Gujwa-eup, in the eastern part of Jeju, Yongnun-oreum is one of the natural healing spots. Yongnunoreum, which has a graceful curvaceous taste, has also become the background for the films <Wolf Boy> and <Jisel>. It is not very high and the walking path is gentle, so anyone can easily climb it. In the distance, Udo and Seongsan Ilchulbong, opposite Dalangsi Oreum and Adaeng Dareum Oreum, unfold like pictures. In the play, there is a scene where Wisdom and Hyunwoo step on cow dung, sometimes it's a real situation, so be careful with your feet. It's a human road, so cows never try to cover up.

The dragon eyes that raise the cows are raised
scene # 3. Lee Joong-Seop Art Museum Dreaming of Pure Love

The medium of love that connected wisdom and Hyunwoo was a book about painter Lee Joong-seop. During the trip, the two visit the Lee Joong-Seop Art Museum. The Lee Joong-seop Art Museum in downtown Seogwipo is an art museum commemorating the artist Lee Joong-seop, famous for <The Bull>. Lee Joong-seop, who fleeed to Seogwipo with his family to avoid the Korean War, lived here for about a year and left several works including <The Illusion of Seogwipo>.

An art museum exhibiting artist Lee Jung-seop's letters and works

In front of the Lee Joong-seop Art Museum, the residence where the painter Lee Joong-seop and his family lived is preserved. Even though it was reflected in the drama, Lee Joong-seop suffered from the extreme heights of life in which his family lived in a narrow room. However, Lee Joong-seop remembered the days of Seogwipo, where his family lived in needy times, as the happiest time. Looking at his writings and letters displayed at the museum, one can guess how much Lee Jung-seop, who had left his family in Japan, missed those days. Here, sympathy with the pure love of painter Lee Joong-seop reveals his honest thoughts about love and marriage.

A house where painter Lee Joong-seop lived with his family at the time of the Piran
scene # 4. Shinchang Wind Farm & Olle 10 Course Beach

Wisdom and Hyunwoo walk on the road with an awkward heart for some reason, but suddenly thick raindrops begin to fall. It's raining, and it's raining like a heavy rain. Hyun-woo takes off his clothes and covers them with wisdom so that they don't get wet. Soon a giant pinwheel visible behind them. It is a wind farm created on the coastal road between Sinchang and Yongsu in southwestern Jeju. It is famous for its numerous CFs, dramas, and movie locations. Standing underneath the wind power generator, the sound produced by the huge wings spinning can be overwhelming. This coastal road is a great way to enjoy a drive with your lover.

Shinchang Wind Farm in the scene where I met a heavy rain and ran

The sea where Wisdom and Hyunwoo walked along Olle-gil and looked together. They decide to meet there again to confirm their honest feelings toward each other. The beach was like fate to them. You will meet when you follow Olle Trail to the place where it connects to Hwasun Geumsand Beach, the starting point of Olle 10 Course. The beach surrounded by rocky rocks and Brothers Island overlooking Asrai in the distance create an exquisite landscape. The sandy beach, which is so beautiful that your feet will fall out, shines brightly when reflected in the sunlight in line with the nickname “Gold Sand”.

Where Hyunwoo and Wisdom promised the last reunion
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Jeju International Airport → Doryeong-ro → Nohyeong-ro → Aejo-ro → Turn right at the entrance of Aewol → Aewol-ro → Aewol Handam Park → Aewol Handam Trail

* public transport

Take the Seoilju Line from Jeju Intercity Bus Terminal and get off at Handam-dong Bus Stop

2. Restaurants around

Donsadon: Muscle meat / 15, Gwangpyeong-dong-ro, Jeju-si / 064-746-8989 / http://www.돈사돈.kr

Orae noodles: Gogi noodles / 17, Jewon-gil, Jeju-si / 064-742-7355

Jeju Samda noodles: Gogi noodles / 59-1, Kimjeonghwa-ro, Seogwipo-si / 064-739-3167

3.Accommodation

Yeha Guesthouse House Hall: 278 Seogwang-ro, Jeju-si / 064-756-5506 / www.yehaguesthouse.com

Sum Guest House Jeju Airport Branch: 2-2 Seogwang-ro 5-gil, Jeju-si / 070-8810-0106 / www.sumhostel.com/jeju

item.title: A romantic trip to Jeju along the <goddess of marriage> - Jeju, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
The Aewolhandam Walkway filmed the drama 'The Goddess of Marriage'

A romantic trip to Jeju along the <goddess of marriage>

Jeju, Jeju, Korea

On a path I left alone, if I met a love that is meant to be with my life ... . It will be the best moment in life that anyone dreams about once. In the drama <The Goddess of Marriage>, which shows different values and philosophies about love and marriage, a couple who met a fateful love on a trip to Jeju, which happened to happen by accident, appears. They will have to watch more about how the love that blossomed will develop in the future, but the journey of those who have traveled all over Jeju has thrilled the hearts of many. Along the way Wisdom (Nam Sang-mi) and Hyun-woo (Lee Sang-woo) walked together, how about dreaming a romantic trip that might happen to me?

scene # 1. Wisdom and Hyunwoo's First Meeting and Aewolhan Dam Trail

Wisdom, who is confused by the uncertain marriage, is on the plane for Jeju alone on the excuse of a business trip. Hyun-woo, who sleeps, leans toward Hyun-woo, who sits in the next seat, and Hyun-woo, who gives wisdom to her shoulders, sees the book she dropped in curiosity. The wisdom that disappeared in an instant as soon as the plane arrived in Jeju. But thanks to a book she forgot, the two of them accidentally reunite the next day, and after a misunderstanding, they start walking along the road.

On the third morning, Hyunwoo leads the wisdom of going alone. Wisdom is stylish, but he smiles brightly and runs along the coastal promenade. Uh, but where the hell are you ?! Even though she was immersed in the drama, the momentary spirit flashes in the fantastic scenery behind her.
Aewol Handam Trail. Even though it passed by briefly for only 2 ~ 3 seconds on the screen, it is too much to be considered as such a place. A walkway was created along the coastline of Handam Village located in Aewol-eup, Jeju, and the mood of walking along the path is amazing. Anyone who knows that this wonderful coastal walkway is hidden beneath the roadside is a place that can be counted as the hidden unexplored Jeju of Jeju Island. Nowadays, there are more and more tourists coming to this place through word of mouth and internet.

Walkway leading to Gwakjiwamul Beach

From the Aewol Handam Park, which is directly adjacent to the three-way intersection of Seoilju-do and Aewol entrance, go down the stairs to the coast and it is directly connected to the promenade. There is a good walking path from Handam Village to Gwakjiwamul Beach about 1.2km. Looking down from the hill, it has a flexible curve, and it takes about 20 minutes by walking from end to end. Inwardly bent, basalt and white sand, rounded like a mongdol, remind us of the secret beach. The mysterious lava stone statues carved by nature from a long time ago provide a highlight.

A white beach hidden in the middle of the promenade

Most of all, the scenery created by the blue sky and the white clouds and the sea glistening with emerald colors, as if popping popcorn, evokes excitement. Just looking at me feels calm and peaceful. As I jump into the landscape and see those who enjoy the sea to their heart's content, I think this is a fresh play. You can always move your mind even during the walk, so it's better to go ready to jump into the sea. Maybe it wasn't in the play, but Wisdom and Hyunwoo might have enjoyed snorkeling or bathing here.

Walking path looking at the emerald sea
scene # 2. The road of wisdom and Hyunwoo, from Dosoon Tea Garden to the Dragon Eye

Is there anything more enjoyable than traveling with a good-hearted person? Jiwoon and Hyunwoo spend a fun time with a hum, but it's not been days since they met. While walking between the tea fields while eating ice cream, the place where the children arrived after running through the truck like an innocent child. This situation is set in the play, and it takes more than an hour and a half by car from the Dosun Tea Garden to the Yongun-eori. It's a story that you can never walk or run on. Probably both places are full of charm, so I would have set it up like that.

Dosoon Tea Garden with an impressive green tea garden

Unlike the Osulloc Seogwang Tea Garden, which is popular among tourists, the Dosun Tea Garden spreads out in the southern part of Hallasan Mountain. Even walking slowly through the green tea field feels like a healing.
Located in Gujwa-eup, in the eastern part of Jeju, Yongnun-oreum is one of the natural healing spots. Yongnunoreum, which has a graceful curvaceous taste, has also become the background for the films <Wolf Boy> and <Jisel>. It is not very high and the walking path is gentle, so anyone can easily climb it. In the distance, Udo and Seongsan Ilchulbong, opposite Dalangsi Oreum and Adaeng Dareum Oreum, unfold like pictures. In the play, there is a scene where Wisdom and Hyunwoo step on cow dung, sometimes it's a real situation, so be careful with your feet. It's a human road, so cows never try to cover up.

The dragon eyes that raise the cows are raised
scene # 3. Lee Joong-Seop Art Museum Dreaming of Pure Love

The medium of love that connected wisdom and Hyunwoo was a book about painter Lee Joong-seop. During the trip, the two visit the Lee Joong-Seop Art Museum. The Lee Joong-seop Art Museum in downtown Seogwipo is an art museum commemorating the artist Lee Joong-seop, famous for <The Bull>. Lee Joong-seop, who fleeed to Seogwipo with his family to avoid the Korean War, lived here for about a year and left several works including <The Illusion of Seogwipo>.

An art museum exhibiting artist Lee Jung-seop's letters and works

In front of the Lee Joong-seop Art Museum, the residence where the painter Lee Joong-seop and his family lived is preserved. Even though it was reflected in the drama, Lee Joong-seop suffered from the extreme heights of life in which his family lived in a narrow room. However, Lee Joong-seop remembered the days of Seogwipo, where his family lived in needy times, as the happiest time. Looking at his writings and letters displayed at the museum, one can guess how much Lee Jung-seop, who had left his family in Japan, missed those days. Here, sympathy with the pure love of painter Lee Joong-seop reveals his honest thoughts about love and marriage.

A house where painter Lee Joong-seop lived with his family at the time of the Piran
scene # 4. Shinchang Wind Farm & Olle 10 Course Beach

Wisdom and Hyunwoo walk on the road with an awkward heart for some reason, but suddenly thick raindrops begin to fall. It's raining, and it's raining like a heavy rain. Hyun-woo takes off his clothes and covers them with wisdom so that they don't get wet. Soon a giant pinwheel visible behind them. It is a wind farm created on the coastal road between Sinchang and Yongsu in southwestern Jeju. It is famous for its numerous CFs, dramas, and movie locations. Standing underneath the wind power generator, the sound produced by the huge wings spinning can be overwhelming. This coastal road is a great way to enjoy a drive with your lover.

Shinchang Wind Farm in the scene where I met a heavy rain and ran

The sea where Wisdom and Hyunwoo walked along Olle-gil and looked together. They decide to meet there again to confirm their honest feelings toward each other. The beach was like fate to them. You will meet when you follow Olle Trail to the place where it connects to Hwasun Geumsand Beach, the starting point of Olle 10 Course. The beach surrounded by rocky rocks and Brothers Island overlooking Asrai in the distance create an exquisite landscape. The sandy beach, which is so beautiful that your feet will fall out, shines brightly when reflected in the sunlight in line with the nickname “Gold Sand”.

Where Hyunwoo and Wisdom promised the last reunion
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Jeju International Airport → Doryeong-ro → Nohyeong-ro → Aejo-ro → Turn right at the entrance of Aewol → Aewol-ro → Aewol Handam Park → Aewol Handam Trail

* public transport

Take the Seoilju Line from Jeju Intercity Bus Terminal and get off at Handam-dong Bus Stop

2. Restaurants around

Donsadon: Muscle meat / 15, Gwangpyeong-dong-ro, Jeju-si / 064-746-8989 / http://www.돈사돈.kr

Orae noodles: Gogi noodles / 17, Jewon-gil, Jeju-si / 064-742-7355

Jeju Samda noodles: Gogi noodles / 59-1, Kimjeonghwa-ro, Seogwipo-si / 064-739-3167

3.Accommodation

Yeha Guesthouse House Hall: 278 Seogwang-ro, Jeju-si / 064-756-5506 / www.yehaguesthouse.com

Sum Guest House Jeju Airport Branch: 2-2 Seogwang-ro 5-gil, Jeju-si / 070-8810-0106 / www.sumhostel.com/jeju

Jeju Wonder Resort: 40, World Cup-ro 45beon-gil, Seogwipo-si / 064-739-3001 / www.wonderresort.co.kr

item.title: Jeju, a space that embraces Jeju - Seogwipo, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
In Jeju, it is not difficult to meet the space that naturally draws in the natural energy contained in the landscape beyond the visible landscape.

Jeju, a space that embraces Jeju

Seogwipo, Jeju, Korea

Nature like art, a space filled with nature, art filling the space. Jeju contains the fatal harmony and meaning.

Scenery in canvas
Gidang Museum of Art and Waljong Museum of Art

There is a lot of space in Jeju, where deep forest shades and translucent seas rush even if you are just outside the city. It is a house facing the ascent, as well as a cafe lined by the coast, and architects and artists took their place early and speared through the window to shine the wind and light.
The same is true of the Gidang Museum of Art, Korea's first museum of art. The Gidang Museum of Art has entered the hillside of Seogwipo City, overlooking Mt. Halla. The building was built and donated by Kang Gum-beom, a businessman from Japan, a businessman from Japan, and celebrated his 30th anniversary last year.

Chagyeong. Enjoy the mind of borrowing for a while without trying to have a view.
Inside the Gidang Museum of Art

The museum is full of Jeju's breath wherever it touches. The dongle-dong building is modeled after the ‘nul’ that can be found on Jeju farmhouses. Null is a Jeju dialect of a pile of piled grains piled up in rounds. The outer wall was finished with Jeju basalt so that it could harmonize well with the surroundings.

Exhibition inside the Giangdan Museum
Radial rafters

When you step inside, the rafters exposed radially are impressive. The sunlight and clouds of Jeju rush into the skylights facing the sky. When you walk along the floor drawing spirals, the canvas containing Jeju unfolds one after another. The main writer is a change artist who describes the violent winds of Jeju well and is called a “storm painter”. He is buried in black on an ocher background, showing everything in Jeju landscape. In particular, in the works left behind in the hometown of Jeju in the late 1970s, the sea, thatched houses, crows, sailboats, horses, and stone walls can be found mainly.

Gidang Museum of Art, where Hallasan Mountain, which has its forehead in the mist

Leaving the rough canvas and heading for the art lounge, Hallasan Mountain, which has its forehead in the mist, fills the window. The space without a single picture is bright as if hanging dozens or hundreds of landscape paintings. Depending on the time, the season, and the weather and the condition of the mind, the color and the feel of the brush all change.

The Waljong Museum of Art resembles a soft white porcelain mug that has just been made and placed in the sun.

If the Gidang Museum of Art embraced Halla Mountain, the Walljong Museum of Art draws the sea off the coast of Seogwipo. The Woljong Museum of Art, opened in 2013 near Jeongbang Falls, is home to the dreams of Lee Walljong. The building was built in the form of a soft white porcelain mug according to the artist's concept. It was a collaborative work between Swiss architect David Merculo and Korean architect 10,000 Won, which took only two years to design.
Waljong Museum of Art is characterized by making a lot of windows so that the sunlight spreads evenly. Through the glass, the sea off the coast of Seogwipo glances at a glance. This is because even the height of the window frame is picked one by one so as not to be uncomfortable.

Waljong Museum Exhibition Hall
Roof garden sculptures

In the exhibition room, there are about 100 works of this artist, including paintings, reliefs, wood, and ceramics. Birds, flowers, roe deer, dogs, horses, and bright canvases that people play together go well with the sunny space.
At the rooftop garden, you can meet the warm scenery of Chekseom and Munseom floating in the sea. It is clear when it is clear and cloudy when it is cloudy. If you take a step back and put your gaze toward the sea, the horizon will overflow over the curved outer wall. In the late afternoon, the sea turns to honey color, and its appearance is reminiscent of black tea in a similar mug. If you raise your head to the sky, a stone statue sitting on the watchtower will catch your eye. This work was known as a self-portrait modeled by Lee Wall-jong. On the floor beneath the watchtower, various shapes of pottery works are scattered on each side as if covering a statue.

Rooftop garden of Waljong Museum of Art

Jeju impregnated with modern architecture
Sora Castle, Bontae Museum, Yumin Museum of Art

In the sea off the coast of Seogwipo, there is also “Sora's Castle,” which is meaningful in architectural history. The castle of Sora is believed to be the work of Kim Joong-up, a master of modern Korean architecture. In December 1969, it was built two stories above the ground. Officially, it is ‘unknown by the author’, but it is considered to be the work of Kim Jung-up, or at least strongly influenced by his design techniques and features.
You can meet the castle of Sora by going along the Olle 6 course and heading towards a certain Bangpokpo. Standing crouching on a coastal cliff reminds me of a snail going to the sea. Above all, four pillars made with the beauty of the curve are impressive. On the surface, the mongdol from Jeju sea is closely packed to make a perfect harmony with the building.

The castle of Sora, presumed to be the work of Kim Jung-up
The staircase is narrow and dark, making it feel like you are going into a conch.

As you climb up the rooftop along the staircase, the vast sea rushes. The staircase draws a gentle spiral and goes through the second floor to the rooftop, but the passage is narrow and dark, making it feel as if you are going into a conch. The building was used as an observatory, restaurant, etc., and was included in the disaster risk zone in 2003, leaving it empty for some time. Later, Seogwipo City purchased buildings and surrounding land, and was used as an information center for Jeju Olle Trail from April 2009 until recently. Currently, it is being used as a book cafe after repair and reinforcement work. Few books are available, but there are quite a variety of books, including travel, essays, novels, and fairy tales. Coffee is free.

The building is being used as a book cafe.
The pillars made with the beauty of the curve are impressive.

The other building of Kim Joong-up, who remains in Jeju, is the building of the Faculty of Fisheries, the College of Agriculture, Jeju National University. In 1971, it is now used as Seogwi Jungang Girls' Middle School. Buildings have different appearances depending on the viewing direction, so you cannot predict the other side by looking at only one side. Apparently, the first thing that catches your eye is the western side. The light-shielding film with windows is unique to prevent direct sunlight or rainwater from entering.

An old college of agriculture designed by teacher Kim Joong-up (now Seogwi Jungang Girls' Middle School). The window shade is unique.

Jeju also has a number of sensuous spaces that are touched by world-class architects. The well-known architects, Tadao Ando and Itami Jun, Swiss architect Mario Bota, and Mexican architecture master Ricardo Legoretta have created and filled the space with Jeju's beautiful nature. The prominent architect is far from safe. One of the most famous art museums in Jeju, the Bontae Museum, Yumin Museum of Art, and Glass House all came from his fingertips.

Bontae Museum
Sanbangsan Mountain seen from Asrai based on the margins
A building designed to harmonize naturally with the surrounding landscape

The Bontae Museum was located on the slopes of the foot of Hallasan in Andeok-myeon. The original form (本 態) means the original form and essence, and contains the meaning of exploring the fundamental beauty of man. The exhibition covers the most Korean and the most modern, from embroidery crafts to works by Yayoi Kusama. According to the purpose of the museum's establishment, Ando was contemplating a way to adapt to the land of Jeju and to incorporate Korean tradition and modernity. He designed the building so that it did not deliberately set the ground, but naturally harmonized with the surrounding landscape. At the center, there is a traditional fence of Jeju, and a stream flows along the side to create nature. White rice is a mountain defense mountain seen in Asrai based on the blank space. Sanbangsan, which floats between buildings and over waterways, is beautiful, but it is like a mirage that cannot be grasped.

Stone wall stacked with basalt
Seongsan Ilchulbong is trapped in a long window around a stone wall like a picture.

Yumin Museum of Art and Glass House have entered the outstanding scenery of Seopjikoji. If the glass house protrudes over the tip of the cape and overwhelms nature, the Yumin Museum of Art dwells under the ground and humbly accepts nature.
Yumin Museum of Art was operated as a meditation center “Genius Rossay” and opened in June last year. When you enter the entrance, stone gardens appear on both sides of the road, and the path of water spreads quietly through the garden of wind, where the silver grass winds in the wind. As the sound of water fade, the chakyeong encountered at the end of the road is intense. Seongsan Ilchulbong is trapped in a long window around a stone wall like a picture. On a windless day, it is difficult to imagine where it is from outside and where it is inside.

Yumin Museum of Art

It is an exhibition hall when you descend and descend along the tall wall. The space decorated in the massive iron gate is like a stage designed only for the work. The current exhibition is ‘Yoomin Art Nouveau Collection’. You can admire 47 pieces of glass crafts from Nancy region, France, which are meaningful in art history and design.

A glass house nestled within the outstanding scenery of Seopjikoji
The glass house is a V-shaped building that rises above the ground.

The glass house is a V-shaped building that rises above the ground. From the front, it also seems to stretch towards the sea. The building was built toward Jeong Dong-hyang. In the center, a windy path was laid, and in the front, a rhombic flowerbed was created. The first floor is the Zippo Museum, and the second floor is the restaurant. At the restaurant, you can see Seongsan Ilchulbong and Gwangchigi Beach at a glance.

Seongsan Ilchulbong from the Glass House

Muhyang that bloomed into space
Jeju Chusa Hall and Soam Memorial Hall

Seogwipo is also a city of Muhyang. It is also in Seogwipo, where the best calligraphy artist of late Joseon Dynasty, Kim Jeong-hee, completed the Chusa font, and the master of Soam Hyeonjunghwa, a master of the 20th-century Korean West, wrote to the end of his life.
The Jeju Officer entered Daejeong-eup, Seogwipo-si, where Kim Jeong-hee lived. The building was built of wood, modeled after Chusa's masterpiece, Sehando (National Treasure No. 180). Sehando is a painting sent to the ideal student, the disciple who saved a precious book. The canvas, which consists of a few pine and pine trees in one shabby house, is desolate and lonely. A tree standing firmly in the cold stands for an ideal character that kept its loyalty even in long exile.

Jeju Officer

Seung Hyo-sang is the architect who brought Chusa's work into the landscape of Jeju. Like Hyo-sang's character, Seung Hyo-sang finished the painting with a round window with a clean and clean appearance, and planted pine trees straight on the sides. At the entrance, there was a staircase to go to reproduce the rough journey of Chusa. Most of the exhibition halls are placed underground, but there is no frustrating feeling due to natural light pouring through the high ceilings and glass wall windows.
In the exhibition hall, you can look into the curved side of Chusa through various exhibits. The best thing to see is his writing. In his majestic typeface, his life as well as his studies are melted. In addition, you can appreciate a letter written by acquaintances in order to soothe the loneliness of an exile during the exile period, as well as one of the three limits that Chikashi Fujitsuka, a Japanese Chusa researcher.

A memorial space with a bust of Chusa
Chusa's majestic typeface

If you go upstairs after looking around Chusa's works and table books, it is Chusa Hall. In the empty space, only the bust of Chusa, created by Im Ok-sang's artist, is lying. The extremely understated space gives an intense and deep aftertaste.
When you come out of the exhibition hall, it is a Chuseok beggar. The house where Chusa lived and the life of exile were restored. The street he was staying in was a cramped room about a pyeong. He completed Chusa-cheok here, drew many paintings including Sehan-do, and left many achievements such as teaching scholars and calligraphy to Jeju's larvae.

Soam Hyun Joong-hwa's work 'The Line of View'

Soam Memorial Hall is a space where calligraphy from Seogwipo commemorates Soam Joonghwa. Soam, who studied at Waseda University in Japan, draws a clear stroke in the modern modern western world of Korea after working on the western Japan.
The memorial was built with Jo Beom Sanbang, where Soam lived and lived. Jo Beom Sanbang (眺 帆 山房) means ‘the house overlooking the sailboat’. Soam sat here, fluttering a long beard and did not stop brushing until the paper touched the ceiling. Very rarely, I ate, slept, and wrote only, except for outside access. Soam's stroke resembles Jeju through the window. It is beautiful, but it is bizarre, soft, and changeless. Each point, one stroke, the sea and wind of Jeju stand out.

Soam Memorial Hall Jo Beom Sanbang
The window of the passage connecting the 1st and 2nd floors of the Soam Memorial Hall is modeled after a single figure drawn on Hwasunji.

The memorial hall consists of two permanent exhibition rooms, a planning exhibition room, and Jo Beom Sanbang. The work 'Chwiseon-seon' (는 是 僊), which is said to have taken the lead in the wallpaper due to the rise of the mood, is impressive. Jobeomsanbang is preserved as it was used by Soam. The teacher sitting with a brush is vivid. On the first floor, a collection of hats, canes, etc. that Soam used to enjoy in his lifetime.

Travel information

Seogwipo Architecture Culture Tour
-Seogwipo Architecture Culture Tour is a journey to discover the beautiful scenery of Seogwipo Bay and listen to the story of Seogwipo's history, culture and life through architecture. It is composed of 10 themes and 12 courses with unique charms.

Main Course
-1 course war and modern architecture
Jeju Songaksan Outer Ring Japanese Cavern Site → Jeju Set-Al-Oreum Japanese Cavern Site → Jeju Set-Al-Oreum Japanese Gosapo Site → Jeju 4 · 3 Historic Site Six-Arrow Massacre → Namjeju Airplane Hangar → Altreu Air Base Control Tower → Altreu Airfield → Jeju Mosulpo Alteul Airfield Underground Bunker → Pacific Rim Peace Park → Japan-Japan Financial Union Building → Mosulpo Love House → Namjeju-gu Daejeongmyeon Office → Namjeju Gangbyeong University Church → Army 1st Training Center Main Gate → Jeju-gu Army First Training Center Command Center → Jeju-gu Marine Training Facility
-5 courses Korean architecture master
Gidang Museum of Art → Seogwi Jungang Girls' Middle School (formerly Jeju National University College of Agriculture) → Seogwipo Miracle Library → Old Sora Castle
-10-2 course Tadao Ando
Seopjikoji → Hyeopyeon University → Bangdupo Lighthouse → Glass House → Yumin Museum of Art (formerly Genius Cross) → Agora → Bella Terrace

All courses and course-specific information
-home page : http://culture.seogwipo.go.kr/architours
-Inquiries: Seogwipo City Hall Tourism Promotion Section 064-760-3942, Pong Nang 064-762-2178

item.title: [Korea Travel Bucket List Part 3] This summer's Jeju Island bike tour! - Jeju, Korea
item.description:
Jeju Fantastic Bike Run Running Off the Ocean

[Korea Travel Bucket List Part 3] This summer's Jeju Island bike tour!

Jeju, Korea

Sejong (pseudonym) in his late 40s with the motto of "The journey continues until life is over." He set the summer vacation as Jeju Island. Jeju Island is not the first. Nevertheless, I chose Jeju Island without hesitation because of the expectation of a new trip. What caught Sejong's heart is the coastal round road called 'Jeju Fantastic Bike Path'.
The Jeju Fantastic Bike Path is a course that cycles around Jeju Island along a coastal road with little traffic. It was opened in November 2015. Sejong says the reason for choosing a bicycle tour.
"In the light of my previous experience, I thought I could make the trip enjoyable. When I walked Jeju Olle, I saw a lot of young friends traveling on bicycles, so I also wanted to travel like this one day, and after the trip, I felt like it. "
Even though he grew older and became a middle-aged body, his mind was always young, so Sejong decided to take a bicycle trip to Jeju Island.
Bicycle travel is a new challenge to travel to Jeju Island
Bicycle travel counterclockwise
Sejong's challenge course is 21km from Yongduam Certification Center to Darak Shelter Certification Center. This is the first course of the Jeju Fantastic Bicycle Path. There is a reason for his choice. It would be nice to implement a grand plan called "Jongju" at once, but it is very unlikely. I know that like the mind, the body won't be able to keep up, so I know I have to try it many times. In that case, I decided that it would be better to try in order from the first course. He plans to turn Jeju Island counterclockwise along the coast. That way, you can run facing the sea.
I am not lonely because my friend and the sea are nearby
Sejong has two colleagues to accompany. Put your body on the bike. I never think it will be difficult. It seemed easier than walking. 'Olle also walked, it's about a bike', 'If anyone knows how to ride a bicycle, anyone can do it. I think it's never hard, 'and press the pedal vigorously. Sejong's advice was also comforting to the bloggers' advice that the Jeju Fantastic Bicycle Path was built on a gentle flatland, and that it was easy to find and can be challenged even for beginners.
city
A leisurely run while enjoying the scenery
Even Hagwi-ri runs with care for safety, so it will be fun. Even if the sea is by the side, I cannot afford to enjoy it. When I'm annoyed, I find joy in Sejong. After crossing the Bongcheon 2nd Bridge in Hagwi 2-ri, I went to Aewol Coastal Road on the right, and the desired ride began. Few people pass by, and there are few vehicles. The road is also smooth. After walking for a while on Gamun-dong, the sea comes close to you. Only then can I park my bike for a while and enjoy the sea. The sky is blue, and the sea is infinitely clear and transparent. Sejong enjoys the scenery by saying, 'This is Jeju Island, I did a good job riding a bicycle.'
It is a world of riders with few people and vehicles passing by.
1st course, Aewol-eup coastal road
Aewol-eup coastal road (approximately 10.7 km) is famous for the beautiful sunset that colors the sea.
A more fun bike trip together
However, there are many hills in the area between Gugeolli and Gonaeri, making it one of the most difficult courses on the Jeju Fantastic Bike. Sejong, who cannot tell the truth, is happy. I think that the road ahead will continue to be the same as now.
There is a bicycle road, so it is convenient
From Gamundong-gil, return to Aewol Coastal Road and run. On the well-paved road, a bicycle road is provided separately. The sea doesn't fall off either side. It's a good way to speed up as much as you like. Sejong does not speed up. I didn't want to miss the view of the sea by focusing on running.
The sunset that reddens the world
Trials have come to a well-run colleague. Uphill appeared. I slowly climb the road by applying strength to my legs. The problem is that the ascent is not one. After one is over, another appears. If you go over it, you can see the uphill again. Just looking at it causes dizziness and sighs.
'What do we do. I wonder if I can go. ' just as expected. A bicycle running on the flat land meets uphill, and the speed slows down infinitely. It is natural that the speed decreases as the number of pedaling steps decreases. The jaw fills up. They start to lag behind the party. Shifting hunger whenever it's hard doesn't speed it up. It's hard.
I throw a word if my colleague riding together was frustrated. "The key to shifting gears is maintaining speed. You need to shift in advance so that you can maintain speed even on hills."
If you run at a speed of 15 km on the flat, it means to shift gears in advance so that you can maintain speed before climbing the hill. I understand the problem with my head, but I don't know when to shift gears. 'So when do you want to shift?'
Uphill is always difficult
Sejong woke up and realized as he ran uphill. That he was a person who could not ride a bicycle. I know that cycling around Jeju Island is never easy. Eventually I get off and drag the bike up. When it is difficult, it is a pleasure to travel while walking for a while and relaxingly admiring the seascape over the coastal cliff.
Bicycle paths are a gift from nature
The party has long been out of sight. 'Where should I follow this loneliness and heaviness?' Thinking, dragging a bicycle and walking struggling. In the midst of this, the sparkling sea catches the eye in the summer. If you look at the fantastic sea light, the fascinating color of the sea will never be erased from your mind forever. I am reminded of the words of Plato, an ancient Greek philosopher, suddenly in an enchanting landscape.
"All things are created by nature or human technology, the greatest and the most beautiful are created in nature, and the least and the most imperfect are made by human technology."
When it's hard, let's relax on the coastal cliff
Jeju Island's biggest attraction is still nature. Although people have artificially articulated the beauty of nature, the light is so rich that it is not enough to cover the pure light emitted by nature. As time goes by, the nature that puts on the weight of the years and creates a more serious look. Mr. Sejong admires the greatness of nature and expresses gratitude. From year to year, it contains the sky and clouds, and mixes mountains, trees, and wind to flow as it is.
The road to the beautiful sea
Press the pedal carefully again. It runs slowly as if walking on a frozen river. Being alone is lonely, difficult, but the mind does not shake. No matter how much you run, you are not afraid to encounter endless dawn roads. I have a friend who goes along the way. The sea of Jeju is with me in the name of us. It's like the morning sun shining anytime, anywhere.
Daram Shelter Certification Center
Finally, you can see the destination attic shelter authentication center. The party arrived first and is resting. When he arrives at his destination, Sejong hurriedly leaves evidence. Open the certification notebook and stamp it. The difficult memories of riding are disappearing far away while stamping. The sense of accomplishment that you have done takes its place.
I stamp the certification notebook and go around the bike.
Sejong, who plans to complete a 240km run sometime, even though it runs on one section of Jeju Island. He says. "Bicycle travel is not a challenge. Enjoy nature and time." "I am happy to be able to respond to nature's calling."
Although it was a short, short-distance bike trip, the memories will always remain in your heart. And the time that has passed in a moment will be reminiscent of the memories presented, and will make a trip to make other memories. As time goes by, Jeju Island will change someday, but the truth is, even if Jeju Island changes, travelers will always come.
Bike trip is a trip to enjoy nature
<Jeju Fantastic Bicycle Path>
Ten courses have been developed around the certification center. The length is 240 km. If you run 70 ~ 80km a day, you can do it if you have 2 nights 3 days or 3 nights 4 days. Even running 30km takes 7-8 days. It doesn't matter if you don't have the skills, but don't be greedy. It is important to move on a fixed schedule even if you go slowly. The accommodation is selected in advance according to the route.
<Bicycle Tips>
-Basic safety equipment is essential. Helmets, gloves, knee and elbow guards, etc., should be provided for safe riding.
-Prepare long-sleeved clothes, goggles, sunblocks, etc. in preparation for heat, radiant heat, and sunlight exposure.
-Prepare a repair kit and spare tube that can be repaired in the event of a simple malfunction such as a tire puncture. If you can't do it yourself, check the repair shop contact information.
-Headlights and tail lights are essential when driving at night
-Be familiar with the left and right brake directions and how to operate the transmission.
-The saddle is moderately high enough to reach the ground.
-Since it is necessary to ride a bicycle for a long time, it is also helpful to prepare functional clothes.

Written by Joohwan Oh (Travel Writer)

item.title: Flowering in front of the beach, Gimnyeong Metal Craft Mural Village - Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Metal art murals that have naturally penetrated the village

Flowering in front of the beach, Gimnyeong Metal Craft Mural Village

Jeju, South Korea

A gentle change began along the coastline in a tranquil seaside village north of Jeju. Metal crafts with warm stories of the village bloomed on the walls of the house.
'Gojangnan-gil', which embroiders Kimnyeong village, is a Jeju dialect, meaning 'flowering path'. Sea breezes and sea water flow in the villages, and metal crafts that look wonderful as time goes by bears the warmth.
'Troubleshooting Road' starting at Jeju Olle Trail 20 Course
Permeable metal craft work
Jeju sea is always new. The moment you see the mysterious color, it's likely that fluttering will happen. Jeju's pretty beach is lined with hostels and cafes overlooking the sea. Another way to meet Jeju sea is to walk slowly along the coastline.
The sea and sky of Gimnyeong that is so blue
Gimnyeong, the starting point for Olle 20 course, north of Jeju, is a quiet village with emerald sea. In winter 2014, the change began in an ordinary town where travelers are sparse. Metal art murals were made naturally as if in a village.
Good way to walk along the beach
You can find metal crafts about 3km from the beginning of Olle 20 course to Seongseon Beach. White wings emerged from the blunt cement walls, and whales seemed to jump into the sea right now on the black stone walls. The works of Haenyeo, Gimnyeong Village, which consists of Manjanggul Cave, Cheongsugul Cave, Yacht and Wind, are included in each piece.
Interesting work that applied wall
Take a map and enter the village on Olle Trail 20. By Kim Sung Sook Welcome to this traveler. Travel is a work that expresses the root of the mind with interesting imagination.
It's fun to look for each piece on the map one by one.
The roots of her blunt feet are traveled, and metal leaves hang on top of them to form a rich tree. Works well with Jeju, the romance of travelers.
The work which soaks naturally as if originally attached
Gentle changes to bring villages to life
Did you walk 10 minutes from the start of Olle Trail 20? He enters the cafe 'Backroom Project', nestled under a green roof in front of the beach. The house is remodeled as a farm house, and the outside is used as a workshop for metal crafts. It is run by Nam Hyun-kyung, the artist who planned the streets of Gimnyeong.
Representative Nam Hyun-kyung of Café ‘Dabang Project’
She majored in metal crafts at university, and her dream was to have a workshop in front of the sea, which she settled here two years ago.
Warm room is seeping again
At first, it was a cold village, but curious seniors often visited with vegetables or fruits, and she began to tell her story. Indulged in the charm of the village, the writer searched for warming the neighborhood and chose what he could do best.
Warm room is seeping again
Painting murals are well peeled off by rain and wind and may look heterogeneous, so I chose achromatic metal as a material. In his mind, Nam wanted to make a mural that penetrated the landscape naturally. The village secretariat and the Rural Development Corporation were persuaded for nine months to complete the “Trouble Road Project. As a result, 34 works embroidered the village from the end of October to mid-December 2014.
There are many works that unravel the hearts of women
At first, the village elders did not have the opposition. I didn't know the metalwork itself, and most of all, I had to pierce the walls of my old house. But I was satisfied with the finished mural.
Sneaking through the wall, cat
12 artists participated in the project. It was recruited through SNS, and was introduced to the artist by knowing through school seniors and juniors. Gimnyeong is a seaside village, and its works are mostly made of copper rather than iron because the works can be quickly destroyed by the influence of sea breeze and seawater. “Iron is corroded, but copper is colored. The color changes nicely with sea breeze and sea water. As time goes by, the work gets more and more valuable. ” Representative Nam
Yongcheonsu can be found all over Jeju
The copper is red at first, but as time goes by, the green color rises. The emerald work creates another mood. This is also an attraction of metal crafts. Copper is twice as expensive as iron, but it is more economical because it costs no maintenance and repair.
Colorful roofs along the beach
Works that contain the story of Gimnyeong Village
Leave the project again and walk near the sea. On a wall, we discover Chu-sky's work, Island Kid. It is a work that expresses the strong mother and haenyeo of Jeju. Knowing that there are many fishing points in Kimnyeong, Lee Jung-geun's <WORLD'S BEST FISHING SPOT> shows. In his work, you can see the vibrant and dynamic village.
She stands in front of the haenyeo who goes well with the orange roof. When I look closely at the net that Haenyeo has rescued, it is a flower that bloomed in a lump. Kim Sun-young's <Blossom Wave> expresses that the flowers they have rescued for the rest of their lives are flowers, and their flower-like youth. Lee Hyun-jung's <Cantabile>, which means that fish are harmonized in the life of a haenyeo according to the sound of the sea, is as beautiful as a soft coastline. After this piece, the grandfather is drying up the starfish in the courtyard of an old house. I lived in this village for a lifetime and was bored. One day, a mural blooming like a spring flower is pleasing and the calm change makes me feel happy.
Grandpa drying his starfish in the courtyard of an old house
There are many works that portray Haenyeo, but it is a different feeling when faced with garlic artist 'Wonder HaeNyeo'. I wanted to break down the prejudice against the female divers by expressing the female divers as a wonder woman. “I think Haenyeo is a person who is doing hard work. Especially, women in Gimnyeong are strong, blunt and clunky. Because the land was so poor that I had to make material, and because of the wind and the sound of the waves, I was short and thick when I spoke. The girls and girls I met face to face with exciting music, fun work, and warmth for strangers. I wanted to express it cheerfully that the women were forced to be strong. ”
A mother and a woman who is strong like a wonder woman
In addition to the walls, there are also works that look more detailed when you look up. Lee Jung-geun's Blue Water Glass (Let's Go) is located on a stone wall. In the form of webtoons, it was a fun way to express blue water, a healing water for sick people, a swimming pool for local children, and a spring water for farmers to relax with cows.
Emerald colored metal craft in sea breeze and sea water
Lee Sung-sik's <Walk the Road> contains the mysterious legend of Duruksan, which shows off the sea in Gimyeong. It tells the legend of Durucksan that the grandmother she met on the road is always in the water.
A work that just popped out of a cartoon
Did you walk for about 2 hours? It stands in front of a work that tells the story of Gimnyeong's specialties and the wind. The story of Kim Ning, who is told by the murals, seems to tickle her.
Wall and work that seems to be one originally
Deep in the village, it is filled with works that allow the elderly to feel the wisdom and old fashion of Jeju. The broken roads throughout the seasons will make the town more daunting.
Go
Travel info

Gimnyeong

item.title: Jeju's winter restaurant, comforting betrayed travelers - Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Red Camellia Flower, One of the Typical Winter Landscapes in Jeju

Jeju's winter restaurant, comforting betrayed travelers

Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea

Jeju's winter is a season of betrayal. Many people travel in anticipation of the warm and warm weather, but when they step on the island, they feel something is wrong. Yes. Jeju's winter is much colder than I thought. The bitter winter breezes that drive every once in a while make people's minds cold. Here are two cafes where you can enjoy betrayed travelers with warm winter scenery, special experiences and delicious seasonal desserts.
Camellia walk and warm winter delicacy, Warangwarang
Wimi-ri Village in southern Jeju is an essential part of Jeju's winter trip. A fascinating camellia colony that brings out red flowers in midwinter attracts travelers every year. The Camellia colony, as its name suggests, is not a place where camellia trees form a forest, but the trees that grow along the stone walls are so huge that they look like forests from a distance. Camellia is a native variety, so the flowers themselves are not gorgeous. However, the landscape where blossoms fall and form flower paths is not enough to make the winter trip beautiful.
Camellia colony where the camellia tree grows
Just a few steps away from the camellia community, there is a café called Warangwarang, which is known for its atmospheric and delicious coffee. It is a good place to take a leisurely tour of the camellia colony and drink hot coffee to share the afterglow of the trip. The cafe's exterior, neatly decorated, is very comfortable.
Warangwarang, a cafe near the Camellia colony
production
A citrus field looks out the window
The handwritten menu is full of things to try, including a wide variety of coffees and teas, cookies and juices. Among them, sweet red bean latte and glutinous rice cake are the best delicacies of Warangwarang, which can be enjoyed as a winter dessert. The red bean latte, which is made by boiling domestic red beans, is soft and savory. Fatigue accumulated in pleasant sweetness melts away. If you have a cup of red bean latte with roasted rice cake, you won't have the perfect winter food. Slightly baked rice cakes with plenty of roasted soybean flour make it a little hungry.
A glass of red bean latte with roasted rice cake
In addition to the café, the company's owners make menus from ingredients they eat, as well as operating a certified organic citrus farm and a custom-made furniture workshop. Thanks to this, the citrus menu from the cafe is also made from high-quality citrus from the farm.
Neat and sweetly decorated cafe
Naturally aged soaps and camellia oils made by the couple are also popular. The 'warangwarang' camellia oil and soap, made by OEMs in specialized production facilities, have a reputation for being recommended.
Warangwarang coffee to enjoy with hand drip
Cafes are usually quiet and relaxed, but sometimes they turn into love rooms for residents and travelers. It opens at 11 am and closes at 6 pm and is closed on Mondays.
The cafe is decorated in a cozy and relaxed atmosphere.
Aromatic foot bath, homemade seafood bread, dolgori cafe
As you walk slowly along the wide Pyoseon Haevichi Beach, you will soon reach the Pyoseon port. It is a good place to relax with a clear sea view. Right behind Pogu is the “Doltogori Café,” where you can enjoy desserts and foot baths. The unusual foot bath made of black basalt, homemade gelato and bread are popular warm spaces.
Dolpori Café
1:00 pm. As you enter the cafe, the smell of freshly baked bread irritates your nose. Even though I have just eaten, my mouth is drooling. For those who like to eat bread, and to make bread, the Dolgori Café is just a sparrow mill. The taste is delicious, but you can taste the unique bread that is not found in other bakeries.
Homemade bread, gelato and delicious drinks baked daily
Seafood bread made with squid, mackerel, octopus and conch is a popular bread. There's nothing special on the outside, but the seafood is filled with a different force than any other bread. The texture of the soft bread goes well with the chopped seafood. If you eat one or two, the plate will be empty soon. Jeju citrus bread with sweet and sour citrus is topped with a spoonful of mango gelato. Cool and mellow gelato and sour citrus bread make a fantastic harmony in your mouth. In addition to mangoes, there are a variety of gelato so you can choose your own. Doltogo bread made with potato puree also offers a different look.
Seafood bread with a conch, sea eel, octopus and squid
The second floor of the cafe is decorated with a foot bath. If you want to enjoy a foot bath with desserts, order bread and drinks on the first floor and bring them to the foot bath table. Each foot bath has a table where you can put a drink.
The first floor is a cafe and the second floor is decorated with foot baths.
A little clunky footbath made of jeju stone. Dolgori, which means “pig trough” in Jeju, is interestingly shaped as a foot bath. Best of all, it is convenient because you can set the desired temperature.
You can enjoy foot bath comfortably while enjoying dessert.
When you apply for a foot bath experience, you will bring bath, beauty salt and towels to the basket. Once you know how to use it, you can enjoy the foot bath by yourself.
Bath salt, beauty salt, towel to apply for foot bath experience
Adding a bath will give your feet a pleasant scent and color. You can choose among yuzu, cherry blossom, forest bathing and rose fragrance. Rubbing the beauty salt on the soles of your feet before you finish the foot bath will remove the dead skin cells and make your skin smoother. Wipe dry with a single step and you're done! The fatigue of a midwinter's journey is eased. Foot bath experience is 5,000 won per person.
Put a bath in a footbath
Travel info

Warangwarang

Contact: 070-4656-1761

Dolpori Café

Contact: 064-787-9400

http://www.jejufolk.com/html/index.aspx

http://www.herbdongsan.com/


Rooms

http://www.seriworld.co.kr/index.php?mid=KR01

item.title: Fun and sweet winter museums in Jeju - Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Chocolate Museum

Fun and sweet winter museums in Jeju

Jeju, South Korea

There are many fun museums in winter even on Jeju Island. Among them, the museum introduces an experience museum that can be used to educate children and also be enjoyed by adults.
Chocolate Museum
The Chocolate Museum is amazing from the outside. Once the facade of the museum looks like the architecture of the South American Inca civilization, the birthplace of cacao. Also, as soon as you enter, you are welcomed by the coffee and it is more fun. The Chocolate Museum is a fun place to look at all the chocolates in each region, including the history of chocolate. The museum features chocolate statues and famous cultural works. Is it because it melts because many people touch it with their hands? Of course you should look only with your eyes.
The pavilion starts with a poster for the chocolate factory of the movie Charlie, which will be interesting to children. Also explain how to make chocolate from cacao. There is also a space that reproduces the chocolate of the ancient Aztec civilization, which is intrigued by the model train coming and going around. One side of the museum explains the types and benefits of cacao. I only know that chocolate can help me regenerate, but I first learned that there are so many different types of cacao.

In the museum, there is a quiz game to convey knowledge of various chocolate cacao through not only exhibitions but also quizzes.
It is not just an enumeration, but an exhibition that induces the interest and participation of visitors through various attempts such as chocolate quiz, chocolate misunderstanding and truth.

The second floor displays chocolates and tea cups, mostly from medieval Europe. Chocolate is now popular, but in the past it was only used by the upper classes in Europe as a premium drink. The spaces that explain the colorful and diverse look-and-feel exhibitions and related stories also attracted many people.

Chocolate Museum Experience Center
On the first floor of the museum, there is a space that shows the scene of making chocolate. Unfortunately this is not a place for visitors. For the unfortunate audiences, there is a Junior Experience Hall on the first basement floor where you can make chocolates with your children.
Chocolate Museum Production Room
Teddy Bear Museum
Now let's go to the Teddy Bear Museum located in Jungmun, Jeju Island. Teddy Bear is a teddy bear that everyone knows. I've made and constructed a museum and I'm curious how to decorate it. First of all, it seems to be popular with children in terms of the theme of teddy bears.

Once inside the museum, it consists of various structures, such as a history hall decorated with teddy bear dolls, important events of modern history of humanity, and an art museum decorated with works of art in teddy bears, and exhibitions. Starting with the birth of the car, various events such as the moon landing of mankind and the return of Hong Kong to China are centered on teddy bear dolls. It is an educational museum for children and a cute and cute museum for adults.

The museum's interior art gallery draws Van Gogh's paintings as teddy bears and draws visitors with a variety of themes such as Teddy Bears decorated with Louis Vuitton. There is also a teddy bear souvenir shop in the basement. Parents who have been holding their children's hands can get out of here by buying teddy bear dolls.

Teddy Bear Museum Souvenir Shop

Lastly, there is a hidden teddy bear performance, Elvis Presley. The show is not long, but Elvis Presley dances and music in Teddy Bear and is worth seeing. The venue is located a little far from the main exhibition hall, but don't forget to stop by.

The Teddy Bear Museum has outdoor gardens and outdoor stages as well. These days it's midwinter, so I couldn't go outdoors, but if it's a nice day in summer, the outdoor garden with grass plaza and walking trails will be a good gift for nature with cool sea breeze.

Teddy Bear Museum
Haenyeo Museum
Now move to the Haenyeo Museum near Seongsanpo. Isn't it a haenyeo that can not be missed in Jeju Island? Haenyeo Museum is operated by Jeju Island and consists of three exhibition rooms with the theme of Jeju Island Haenyeo.
The dormitory of Haenyeo, the first exhibition room, shows the life of haenyeo in Jeju Island. A traditional house was recreated and the village of Jeju Island was modeled next to it. In addition, there are various exhibitions such as living utensils, food culture and customs.
Haenyeo Museum

The second exhibition room, Haenyeo's Workplace, is a showroom that maximizes the visual effect by decorating the dolls and showing them as images. You can also find out about the hierarchies of haenyeo and the daily life of haenyeo. There are also spaces that show the achievements of devoted women who have dedicated themselves to the nation, such as the Haenyeo Anti-Japanese Movement.

In the third exhibition room, Haenyeo's life, she can become the first woman in her life and see her various hierarchies. There are also interesting exhibits, such as a video where you can listen to live experiences of divers.

Haenyeo Museum

Lastly, there is the Children's Haenyeok, an experience hall for children. This is a place where only children and guardians can enter. Children can become more familiar with Haenyeo by playing with Jeju Haenyeo related rides.

Haenyeo Museum is proud of its outdoor park. The open-air large park is called Haenyeom Square, which also houses the Jeju Haenyeo Anti-Japanese Movement Memorial Monument.


Haenyeo Museum

item.title: Wiesen Village, an oasis of body and mind that wants to relax life - Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Jade sea is the pride of Jeju Island

Wiesen Village, an oasis of body and mind that wants to relax life

Jeju, South Korea

'Summer vacation is one year.' How long have you been dreaming? Like the squirrel wheel and the freedom of the gold that leaves the fixed life frame and seeks a strange sun, it is the golden time that is allowed for us.
I unfolded the map and pondered where to go. Tourists face the tropical mood, palm trees, the jade sea running over the white sand, and the hot sun. Jeju Island has already become a landscape by its name. There is also a resting place to quench my thirst like an oasis in my body and mind that wants to rest.
Bizen Village where various spaces coexist
Bizen Village is in the middle of the Hadori Carrot Field on the east side of Jeju Island. Although it opened this year, it is already a cultural space with industrial design and vintage props among those seeking a trendy lifestyle. Travelers are sheltered with dormitories, penthouses and camping trailers, but they are not just places to sleep. It is a complex cultural space with various facilities for relaxation such as a restaurant hard table, an organic farm cafe beer round, a loft market selling vintage props and longboards, a gallery displaying lighting collections and an outdoor swimming pool.
There is a large swimming pool in the middle of the yard.
There is nothing urgent in Bizen Village. Move slowly and enjoy nature, and relax without doing anything. Above all, it is better to interact with travelers. The worries here are: 'Swim or read a book or a beer?' I only do it. Therefore, Bizen Village is not called a hotel or a pension. It is said to be a hangout of stylish travelers.
Basketball court on one side of Bizen Village
Industrial Design meets Boutique Hotel Design
It is just the first meeting with Bizen Village. Buildings and containers like warehouses say 'what is this?' It makes you think. But when you look at the rooms that are stylish and vintage, you change your mind. It's like looking at a boutique hotel in Europe.
6-Bed Dormitory <Photo courtesy of Bizen Village>
Rooms vary in dormitory, couple room, penthouse and camping trailer. Considering the purpose and taste of travelers. If you are traveling alone, a dormitory, a couple's room for couples or couples, a penthouse is a good choice if you want to spend a luxurious night. If you want to have a special experience with the romance of your trip, we recommend camping trailers.
Utilizing the texture of wood, you can feel warm sensibility.
Dormitory is the pride of Bizen Village. The name 'village' is used because it stands for 'village inhabitants'. Six and four rooms were set up in three buildings so that more than 100 people could relax.
Neatly decorated couple rooms
If you think 'the dormitory is there, what's wrong'. The dormitories here are different from those of a typical guest house.
Penthouses in Bizen Village
Travelers who have used dormitories know. How hard it is to find a good bed. Bizen Village is a bed made of wood for the traveler to stay as comfortable as possible. You don't have to worry about sleeping. Classic joint lighting is used as an interior accessory to add a warm atmosphere.
Bathroom in a penthouse
The composition of the three spaces is the same, and the color of the room and the material of the furniture have changed. It is a space where anyone can rest casually and form a consensus among travelers.
A lamp is both a light and an interior accessory
The penthouse can be thought of as a royal suite of a deluxe hotel. The exterior is a container, but the interior is finished with wood texture and filled with furniture collected by the owner, giving the 1970s vintage sensibility.
Gield's joint lighting reveals the traces of time
Vintage furniture and lights are Orissa chairs by Wim Rietveld, famous for their lighting and vintage furniture designs by Kaiser Idell, Louis Poulsen and Gielde All.
There is no ordinary lighting in Bizen Village
None is inadvertently placed. Under thorough calculations, it is properly positioned to feel the analog sensitivity. The stylish interior space meets the analog sensibility and is born as a place where present and past coexist. The same design concept was applied to the Avion camping trailers obtained from the United States.
Unique furniture and arrangement avoided the monotony of the room
The special lighting in each room is related to the history of the owner Choi Jung-hoon. He ran the interior company dot-to-design and vintage lighting & furniture shop loft market in Seoul. Then I came to Jeju with the idea of creating a boutique hotel where old and modern emotions coexist.
Stylish rooms with simplicity
I found a landscape full of carrot fields in Hadori and built a Bizen Village. Then he brought a selection of precious vintage lights, furniture, and speakers. This allows visitors to and from Bizen Village to encounter original vintage props that can only be seen in museums, rather than beautifully imitated interior props.
Bizen Village Night View
Vintage and chic but modern
Bizen Village's cafés, restaurants, editorial shops and galleries have a strong industrial feel. Exposed concrete, crunchy design, old props… . The vintage, chic but modern atmosphere makes you feel like you are in a foreign country.
Industrial Café Beer Round
The editor's shop Loft Market sells longboards and high-low furniture as well as outdoor goods and clothing. It is a selection of things that the owner likes.
Loft market selling items collected by the owner
Restaurant Hado Table is a great place to enjoy brunch dishes made with organic vegetables grown directly in the garden. It is a restaurant during the day, but at night it is transformed into a pub & club where you can drink beer and dance.
Breakfast made with organic ingredients
Organic Farm Cafe Beer Round is Jeju's favorite spot for women. There are many cute accessories to take pictures in unique atmosphere. JBL and Altec's vintage speakers are installed at one side of the café for use as a guitar or performance.
Glass bottle decoration of cafe
Choi Jung-hoon dreams that all spaces in Bizen Village will be used as wedding halls for small weddings, flea markets for artists, and ballrooms for dance parties. It is not a place to sleep and go to Jeju Island, but to enjoy a new culture, interact with people, and hope to be a cultural space.
Cafe Beer Round is a favorite spot for women
Hado Beach and Bijarim with the beauty of Jeju
Listening to nature is a way to use Bizen Village. Hado Beach is a 10-minute walk away. Woljeongri Beach and Bijarim are not far away. Hado Beach is a great place to surf. Even if you're not surfing, you can enjoy the sea with snorkeling and kayaking. You can walk on the sand while listening to the subdued sounds of the waves, or dive into the sea.
I want to take pictures
It is also happy to walk into the bizarre forest and take a refreshing wind to escape the hot sun. Bijarim is so luxuriant as the Millennium Forest. Walk the promenade and you'll find many different sized trees. The reason why it looks small compared to the age is because the growth rate of the non-tree is slow. It is the world's largest single-forest forest.
Bijarim, called the Millennium Forest

item.title: Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea - Shooting while breathing with nature: ATV Experience Center, Jeju Daeyu Land
item.description:
Clay shooting in nature

Shooting while breathing with nature: ATV Experience Center, Jeju Daeyu Land

Seogwipo, Jeju, South Korea

Jeju is open for four seasons and is a paradise for leisure sports enthusiasts. Even though autumn is over, we are on the threshold of the cold season, but in Jeju you can still enjoy various activities under the warm sunshine. In addition, special sports activities such as shooting that are not easily accessible are also possible. We visited Daeyuland to experience clay shooting, rifle and pistol shooting.

Pleasure to hit the flying disc! Clay shooting

Daeyu Land is located in the middle mountainous area of Seogwipo City and is the only place where you can experience clay shooting in Jeju. In addition to the clay shooting range, which is made up of indoor and outdoor spaces, 330ha (about 1 million pyeong) of Jeju's nature, there are rifle, pistol shooting range, and ATV experience ground.

bang! The sound is thrilling all over the body. The exhilarating energy of the air blows through the whole body at once. You haven't hit the target, but you will be happy regardless of your success. Follow the staff's instructions and shoulder the gun again. Second shot! The flying disc is hit by a bullet, split into two, and falls off without force. I am excited like children with more pleasure than before. I feel like old stress washed away at once. The first world of shooting is a series of curiosity and surprises. Once you have tasted clay shooting with nature, you have no choice but to fall in love with it.

Camellia blooms on the way to the shooting range.

Clay shooting is a leisure sport in which clay disks are thrown into the air. Because you have to hit moving objects, you need a lot of quickness and concentration. Above all, the pleasure of hitting the flying disc is very exciting. Even beginners can learn without difficulty, so everyone can try it.

Professional staff members are placed one-on-one during shooting experience

Clay shooting uses a shotgun. With the buttocks on your shoulders, one hand holds the trigger side and the other hand supports the muzzle unsteadily. Shotguns are large and heavy and have a large recoil after shooting. Therefore, it is necessary to keep both feet firmly on the ground and posture before shooting. When the disc is slightly below the muzzle, firing increases the hit rate. Wearing earplugs is a must since the gunfire sounds very loud after launch. Shooting a total of 16 shots, of which only 5-7 hits are great skills. If you are confident in clay shooting, you can also go hunting for wild pheasants.

Loading ammo into shotgun
Aim at the target! Rifle and pistol shooting
Opposite the Clay Shooting Range, there is another space for pistol and rifle shooting. Pistols and rifle shots aim at targets that do not move in the shooting range surrounding bulletproof glass.
There is a rifle and pistol shooting range opposite Clay Shooting Range.
The scores are given for each target range, so you can also compare your shooting skills. After the experience, you can take your target as a souvenir.
Pistols and rifle ranges are bulletproof glass.
The pistol extends the arm forward and holds it with both hands. Close one eye and match the target and muzzle with the other eye. And launch! Less recoil after firing than clay shots, but shots are as good as shotguns. Of course, earplugs are a must.
Aim and fire at the still target
The most exciting time to check the target plate after shooting.
Hold the pistol as if it's wrapped with both hands
If the pistol is too small and the shotgun is a bit of a burden, we recommend rifle shooting. Best of all, the gun is light and easy to position. Like a pistol, close one eye and aim at the target. If you've been to the army, rifle shooting can be quite familiar.
Travelers experiencing rifle shooting
Surprisingly, women enjoy shooting quite a lot of fun, but often score better than men.
Grand Master Shooter list of high scorers

The ammunition used in the shooting experience is all used in practice, so be careful about your safety during the experience. Daeyu Land has professional staff at the shooting range to help tourists experience shooting safely. In addition to clay shooting, pistols and rifle shooting can be enjoyed by anyone of all ages. However, you can experience from age 14 or older.

Travelers holding their targets as souvenirs
ATV instincts run on four wheels!

Shooting experiences are somewhat short, usually taking between 15 and 20 minutes. If you feel uncomfortable, take a step to the ATV experience. You can enjoy the joy of enjoying the great nature while enjoying the blowing wind.

ATV Experience

ATV is a popular leisure sport that runs through nature including wild off-road, mountains and fields. Anyone who can't drive can experience ATV, so many families visit. However, you can hold the steering wheel yourself at least 14 years old, and you can carry children in front of or behind the driver's seat.

Travelers trained before hands-on training
Tomb The engine starts to sound up lightly. The faces of experienced visitors wearing helmets and waiting for departure signals are recalled. Finally starting! Rolling movements and vibrations are transmitted to the passengers as if the big wheel bounced off the bumpy road.
Anyone can easily experience ATV
Run off-road breathing with nature as if you were an explorer. Sometimes the fun will blow away the dust and your mind will be calmed. The ATV experience is very satisfying to enjoy for stress relief.
ATV breathing with nature
Travel info
